text.lat: 90.— Solon iuvenes haec praecepta docuisse dicitur. ‘Fidem pluris quam iusiurandum habetote: ne unquam mentiti sitis: rebus magnis operam date; ne amicitias ocius contraxeritis, contractas ne absolveritis; parere imperio edocti, ipsi aliis imperate. Ne suavissima consilia dederitis, sed optima; duci parete rationi: cum malis habitare nolite: deos colitote, patres matresque ne neglexeritis.’
text.eng: 90.— Solon is said to have taught the youth these precepts. ‘Hold faith more important than an oath: never lie: give attention to great matters; do not form friendships too hastily and do not break those you have formed; having learned to obey authority, command others yourselves. Do not give the sweetest advice, but the best; follow reason; do not live with wicked people: worship the gods, do not neglect your father and mother.’
